doc:
Mickey Knox https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mickey_Knox 0 Abraham "Mickey" Knox (December 24, 1921 − November 15, 2013) was an American actor with nearly 80 films to his credit. He was also a screenwriter, film producer and novelist. Blacklisted during the McCarthy era, he moved to Paris and Rome to work. His screenwriter credits where he adapted approximately 150 Italian and French into English translations include the English adaptation of Sergio Leone's The Good, the Bad and the Ugly. As a dialogue director he coached many non-English speaking actors in performing convincingly in the English language. Abraham_"_Mickey_"_Knox ( December_24 , 1921_− November_15_,_2013 ) was an_American_actor with nearly_80_films to his_credit . He was also a_screenwriter , film_producer_and_novelist . Blacklisted during the_McCarthy_era , he moved to Paris_and_Rome to_work . His_screenwriter_credits where he adapted approximately_150_Italian_and_French into English_translations include the_English_adaptation of Sergio_Leone 's_The_Good , the_Bad and the_Ugly . As a_dialogue_director he coached many_non-English_speaking_actors in performing convincingly in the_English_language .
